intro: Chisocheton rigidus, commonly known as the rigid chisocheton, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other hardwood trees. The plant is characterized by its elongated, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
